bin/baltsp-lb.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Bottleneck Assignment Problem solver.
00003  *
00004  * Solves the bottleneck assignment problem (BAP) on the given input file.
00005  *
00006  * @author  John LaRusic
00007  * @ingroup bin
00008  ****************************************************************************/
00009 #include "common.h"
00010 #include "baltsp.h"
00011 
00012 /* Global variables */
00013 char *program_name;             /**< Program name */
00014 char *input_file = NULL;        /**< Given input TSPLIB file */
00015 char *xml_file = NULL;
00016 int deep_copy = ARROW_FALSE;
00017 int btsp_min_cost = -1;
00018 int btsp_max_cost = -1;
00019 int mstsp_min_cost = -1;
00020 
00021 /* Program options */
00022 #define NUM_OPTS 6
00023 arrow_option options[NUM_OPTS] = 
00024 {
00025     {'i', "input", "TSPLIB input file", 
00026         ARROW_OPTION_STRING, &input_file, ARROW_TRUE, ARROW_TRUE},
00027     {'x', "xml", "File to write XML output to",
00028         ARROW_OPTION_STRING, &xml_file, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00029     {'d', "deep-copy", "stores data in full cost-matrix",
00030         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &deep_copy, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_FALSE},
00031         
00032     {'t', "btsp-min-cost", "min cost in BTSP tour",
00033         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &btsp_min_cost, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00034     {'u', "btsp-max-cost", "max cost in BTSP tour",
00035         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &btsp_max_cost, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00036     {'v', "mstsp-min-cost", "min cost in MSTSP tour",
00037         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &mstsp_min_cost, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE}
00038 };
00039 char *desc = "Bottleneck assignment problem solver";
00040 char *usage = "-i tsplib.tsp [options] ";
00041 
00042 /* Main method */
00043 int 
00044 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00045 {   
00046     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00047     arrow_problem *problem;
00048     arrow_problem input_problem;
00049     arrow_problem_info info;
00050     int lb_result;
00051     double start_time, end_time, lb_time;
00052     
00053     /* Read program arguments */
00054     if(!arrow_options_parse(NUM_OPTS, options, desc, usage, argc, argv, NULL))
00055         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00056 
00057     /* Read the problem file */
00058     problem = &input_problem;
00059     if(!arrow_problem_read(input_file, problem))
00060         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00061     
00062     /* Get problem information */
00063     if(!arrow_problem_info_get(problem, ARROW_FALSE, &info))
00064         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00065     
00066     /* Solve BalTSP LB */
00067     start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00068     if(!arrow_balanced_tsp_lb(problem, &info, btsp_min_cost, btsp_max_cost, mstsp_min_cost, &lb_result))
00069     {
00070         arrow_print_error("Could not solve BalTSP LB on file.");
00071         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00072     }
00073     end_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00074     lb_time = end_time - start_time;
00075     
00076     printf("\nBalTSP LB Solution: %d\n", lb_result);
00077     printf("Total Time: %5.2f\n", lb_time);
00078     
00079     /* Print out XML file if required */
00080     if(xml_file != NULL)
00081     {
00082         FILE *xml;
00083         if(!(xml = fopen(xml_file, "w")))
00084         {
00085             arrow_print_error("Could not open xml file for writing");
00086             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00087             goto CLEANUP;
00088         }
00089         
00090         fprintf(xml, "<arrow_bound type=\"BalTSP\" ");
00091         fprintf(xml, "problem_file=\"%s\"", input_file);
00092         fprintf(xml, " command_args=\"");
00093         arrow_util_print_program_args(argc, argv, xml);
00094         fprintf(xml, "\">\n");
00095         fprintf(xml, "    <objective_value>%d</objective_value>\n", lb_result);
00096         fprintf(xml, "    <total_time>%.5f</total_time>\n", lb_time);
00097         fprintf(xml, "</arrow_bound>\n");
00098         
00099         fclose(xml);
00100     }
00101         
00102 CLEANUP:
00103     arrow_problem_destruct(&input_problem);
00104     arrow_problem_info_destruct(&info);
00105     return ret;
00106 }
